    • Method Detail

      • createWorld

        public World createWorld(int[][][] terrainTypes,
                         TerrainChangeListener modelListener)
                  throws ModelException
        Description copied from interface: IFacade
        Create a new world of the given size and with the given terrain. To keep the GUI display up to date, the method in the given listener must be called whenever the terrain type of a cube in the world changes.
        Parameters:
        terrainTypes - A three-dimensional array (structured as [x][y][z]) with the types of the terrain, encoded as integers. The terrain always has the shape of a box (i.e., the array terrainTypes[0] has the same length as terrainTypes[1] etc.). The integer types are as follows:
        • 0: air
        • 1: rock
        • 2: tree
        • 3: workshop
        modelListener - An object with a single method, TerrainChangeListener.notifyTerrainChanged(int, int, int) . This method must be called by your implementation whenever the terrain type of a cube changes (e.g., as a consequence of cave-ins), so that the GUI will correctly update the display. The coordinate of the changed cube must be given in the form of the parameters x, y and z. You do not need to call this method during the construction of your world.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • setCubeType

        public void setCubeType(World world,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int z,
                        int value)
                 throws ModelException
        Description copied from interface: IFacade
        Set the terrain type of the cube at the given coordinates the given value.
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which to set the type.
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube
        value - The new value of the terrain type of the cube, encoded as an integer according to the values in IFacade.createWorld(int[][][], TerrainChangeListener).
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.

        public void moveToAdjacent(Unit unit,
                           int dx,
                           int dy,
                           int dz)
                    throws ModelException
        Description copied from interface: IFacade
        Move the given unit to an adjacent cube.
        Specified by:
        moveToAdjacent in interface IFacade
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to move
        dx - The amount of cubes to move in the x-direction; should be -1, 0 or 1.
        dy - The amount of cubes to move in the y-direction; should be -1, 0 or 1.
        dz - The amount of cubes to move in the z-direction; should be -1, 0 or 1.
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.

      • createTaskFactory

        public ITaskFactory<?,?,Task> createTaskFactory()
        Description copied from interface: IFacade
        Create a new instance of a Task factory.

        This factory is used by the parser (TaskParser) to construct an in-memory representation of your program. For example, when reading the task description 

         name: "test"
 priority: 1
 activities: moveTo here;
        the parser will create a Task object by (conceptually) executing the following code: 
         factory.createTask("test", 1, factory.createMoveTo(factory.createHerePosition()))
        on the returned factory object.

        For testing, you may use the methods from TaskParser yourself, as demonstrated in the partial test file Part3TestPartial.

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed(Task task)
                     throws ModelException
        Description copied from interface: IFacade
        Returns whether the given task is well-formed. A task is well-formed if
        • it is type-safe
        • there are no break statements outside loops
        • variables assigned before they are first used
        See the assignment text for more details.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to check for well-formedness
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.
